content.description:
Located on the detached feature just behind, or to the right of, Goddamn Bush, this line of bolts ascends the northeast arête of this formation. Tricky moves clear the roof at the base and belayer should be on alert until the second bolt is clipped. Mostly good rock follows with some places where we have tried to clean all the loose stuff away. Beware the potential for loose hand and footholds, however.  

  Stemming across the corridor significantly lowers the difficulty for this route.
content.location: on the right side of the "corridor" as you're looking in from the north side.

content.description: The west facing rock accessed from the same location as Goddamn Rock, on the inside of the corridor between the detached rock and the main slope. The bush in question was removed after it messed up the ground up on-sight solo FA of AMH. The prickly yucca midway up was left in the rock as a tribute to the Goddamn Bush. A single bolt protects the steep face with ample good handholds, but poor gear. Good warm up.
content.location: North facing face within the corridor of Cherub.

climbs.name: Cherubino
climbs.fa: Arjun Heimsath, Hanna Breetz and David Sampson

content.description: The northwest facing arête that is basically pointing towards the Faulty Towers and Torch areas. Start up a left-leaning thin crack, protecting with gear, clip first bolt to protect the cruxy bulging face. Gear and bolts protect the rest of the climb to anchor shared with Cherubette. Harder moves get you through the thin, bulging face.
content.protection: Small to medium cams and 3 bolts.

content.description: Start up a crack located behind a tree just outside the corridor between the main wall and the free standing Cherub. Follow the crack to a face which leads to the top (anchors).
content.location: North face of Cherub, see photos.

content.description: This detached buttress provides good shade and some good rock that is worth warming up on before scrambling up to the main ledge below God Knows. Some warms ups are set and there are numerous other options that can be climbed here. Cherub is also a nice staging area for the final scramble up to The Face of God Area.
